Your name is Brad. You are the most popular boy in school, yet you have no girlfriend, yet. You are sitting in the living room watching ESPN's Sportscenter when your mom calls you to tell you that dinner is almost ready. Meanwhile your sister, Cindy, comes downstairs and immediately changes the channel to some Ballet concert. You shout, "Change it back!" but she just sticks out her tongue, making you even madder. Suddenly you hear something upstairs.

You walk upstairs toward your room. You slowly open your door and are immediately blinded by a white light. When everything clears, you find the hard floor of your room expanding. Oh No! you've shrunk. You must be about 1 inch tall! Before you can do anything, you hear the sounds of tap tap on the stairs. Its your sister coming back upstairs wearing her brown medium heel sandals! She's has no idea what has happened to you.

The trembling of the ground and the booming clacks of your mom's heels reminds you that you need to think quickly before you lose your opening.
123112211211111112221111112121112112121.title: Fork in the road

1231122112111111122211111121211121121211.content:
You dash out of the grass and stop yourself into the center of the walkway. You stand your ground as you look at your giantess mother walking towards you. You try and use the ear piece to contact her, but all you get is static. "Great!" You mutter to yourself. Your mom's footsteps get louder, unaware that you are in her path. "MOM!" You scream, "Don't step on me!"

Your yelling proves pointless as she continues her stride. You stare as her legs rise into what you perceive as the skies only to come crashing to the ground a like divine wrath from above. You zone out as you once again find yourself staring in awe of your gigantic mother. Her dress swaying with every motion of her body, her hair flowing in the air as ahe walks on. From what you could tell you had crossed paths with a goddess.

You are snapped out of your trance when her red heel pump crashes next to you. The sheer size of her pump is comparable to that of a house to you, even the toes of her pumps are taller than you. You look up and see under your mother's dress as the hims seem to hover midair over you and the rest of her legs are eclipsed by the skirt of her dress. You are snapped out of your trance when her other pump comes crashing down. You take this chance to hoist yourself onto the toe of her pump and hug it with all your strength. You are lifted into the air as she walks on towards her car. You take a peak of your surroundings and see the birdbath location getting closer.

When your mother nears the birdbath you hoist yourself off the side of her pump and roll onto the pavement, suprisingly unscaved. You look on as your mom exits the frontyard, the skirt of her polka dot dress swaying left and right. You keep watching her walk on until she is gone from your view. You had had an almost near death experience at the feet of your mother, but you feel energized, gaining your second wind.

Once the thundering footsteps subside you walk towards the birdbath and bask in the mere scale of it. What was once a 3 to 4 foot fountain is now a skyscraper. Just another reminder of your diminutive stature. You scan the area looking for the earring. You see something sparkling in the distance. Taking a closer look you recognize it as the earring you are looking for. You approach it when...
1231122112111111122211111121211121121211.title: All Aboard!

1231122112111111122211111121211121121211.content:
You run towards the earring when you see a shadow cast over you. You jump out of the way as a bird nearly gets you with its talons. You gain your balance and see what appears to be a normal sparrow, but to you its a giant beast blocking your way. You stand still watching the bird and vice versa. The both of you wait for the other to move.

You try to think what you can do, the bird is three times your size with talons that could squeeze the life out of you. The bird gets tired of waiting and lets out a roar, which would be a chirping sound to any normal sized human. It walks towards you and tries to grab you with its beak. You roll out of the way and try to create distance between you guys. The two of you circle around each other when you bump into your mom's earring. You look back and the bird takes this chance to gain altitude and fly down at you.

Instinctively you grab the earring and spin it around like a shotput. You keep spinning to gain momentum and wack the bird as it dives down at you. You get a clean shot at its face and you watch as the bird flys away from the frontyard. You fall back in exhaustion and shock as you almost died a second time this night.

After gaining your composure you play with your earpiece and get a hold of your mom. "I got the earring mom. Ill be waiting by the birdbath." You tell her.

"Good job sweetie," your mom says over the earpiece, "I will be home in about 30 minutes so rest up." You lay against the birdbath and catch your breath. "What a night," you mutter to yourself.
1231122112111111122211111121211121121211.title: The Bird

She looks around for a minute and starts walking towards you. You jump up and start waving and screaming. Your mom appears to see you as her face brightens up with a smile. She proceeds to strut over to you. The quicker pace of her walking creates simeltaneous tremors that cause you to almost lose your balance. Your mom stops right in front of you. You look at her heels then look up at the towering figure in front of you. From your view you can only see up to her breasts. You try and get a look at her face, but fall back trying to do so.

Your mom lets out a thundering laugh as she squats down. You freak out as her legs cast a shadow over you. Her skirt slightly swaying as she squats. You find yourself staring again at what you see as your goddess of a mother. Her smiling face stares down at you as her hand reaches down. You cower as her hand gets closer when you notice her grab the earring next to you. You watch as with just two fingers she picks up her earring, while you needed to use all your strength just to even grab it. She snaps it back on and straightens her hair. You watch as her hair seems to float in the air before falling back into place.

You then see your mom lower her hand to the ground motioning for you to get on. You climb onto her palm and hug her hand as you are thrust into the air as she raises her hand to her face. Once you feel her hand stop moving you stand up and look st your mom's enormous smiling face. Your mom stands back up and walks back into the house. You look back at the yard and think back to what you went through. Your mom sets you on the dining table and walks to the kitchen and brings out dinner.

You compare the plates and see that while your mom is going to eat a full steak you are left with a few crumbs on a plate, which is a full course meal at your size.

Before dinner starts your mom asks you how the frontyard was. You tell her about the bird and decide to leave out you riding on her shoe. Your mom is in shock about the whole ordeal. She picks you up and kisses you with her squishy lips. You dont fight it at first when your mom inhales and almost sucks you up. Your upper body gets stuck between her lips as you wiggle to get free. Your mom spits you out just in time, and begins to laugh as you are once again covered in her lip gloss. You clean your face off and eat your dinner.

You cant help watch as your mom cuts and eats pieces of steak bigger than you with ease. "That could have been me a second ago." You think to yourself as you slowly eat your crumbs while you continue to watch your mom eat. Your mom catches you watching and pets you on the head with her finger. Your face turns red while you eat looking away in embarrassment. Once dinner is over your mom asks if you are going to go to bed.

You decide to...

Anyways, while you are venturing to the birdbath, she is making her way to your house--she needs a cup of sugar--well her mother does anyways.

Becky is wearing a yellow shirt, a black skirt that goes to her knees, and a pair of low casual heels with an ankle strap. As she nears the house's front yard, you start to hear a small "tap tap" on the driveway. Then Becky calls out (loud to your ears):

"Hey Brad!" (your window in your room is open--she thinks you are in there--plus, she doesn't know that you shrunk) "can you let me in? My mom needs a cup of sugar for a cake she's baking."

You cover your ears because Becky's voice is echoing from the driveway. And then it happens, she starts walking into the grass! (She's trying to get closer to the house so she can call up to your window).

"Brad!" she calls again. "Are you home?"

One of her low heel shoes is right next to you--do you try to get her attention--or go back to the earring?

Well, you are no doctor, but you know that when a cut is aggravated, the person with it fools with it till the aggravation is gone. So, without hesitation, you begin to rub your hands along your mother's skin near the cut, especially where the cut begins so she will feel it.

Meanwhile, your mom (believe it or not) is cringing. It's working! For starters, your mom keeps looking down thinking a mosquito is on her foot. Then she shifts her foot around (you have to back up everytime she does). Finally, she makes a small *tap* with her heel to stop the annoyance.

After these three things happen, something amazing happens!
131111.title: Attack the Cut.

1311111.content:
Your mother, aggravated by her ankle, finally looks down for a longer moment. She notices something this time--there's no mosquito bite, but there is a tiny thing near her ankle. Slowly she bends down and immediately her eyes become wide. Thanks to your masterful plan, your mom has spotted you. She sets her hand down and brings you up to the counter.

Your hope turns to worry as your mom grabs a napkin off the counter, turns to look at you, and bends down to grab you with it! She must think you're a bug! You run in the opposite direction as fast as your little legs can carry you. Your mom drops to her knees and lunges forward with the napkin, just narrowly missing you as you run underneath the fridge.

Stopping and panting for air after your unexpected sprint, you hope that your mom will give up the chase and let you be for now as you come up with another plan. But once again, your hopes are dashed as your mom peers underneath the fridge. Lying flat on her stomach, she tries to squirm her massive hand underneath the fridge to squash you! What will you do?

13111122.content:
No doubt if you stay under the fridge, your mom will crush you without even knowing it's her own son and not a bug. The obvious choice is to sprint around the oncoming hand and make your way back into the kitchen, which is exactly what you do. Your mom is still trying to peek under the fridge to locate you, which means she didn't see you run out.

This is turning out better than you expected. Now that she's lying on the ground, you can climb onto her to get her attention somehow. Maybe you could yell into her ear, or tickle her feet, or jump on her back... the possibilities are practically endless. As long as you can come up with a good plan, you're almost sure to make your mom realize it's you. Of course, she may just think you're a bug again, but that's a chance you'll have to take. You don't see any other way to get yourself out of this mess.

When you reach her thigh, it's time to swing to her hand, but it isn't going to be easy. It's moving too much; in fact, both hands are moving. If you climb any higher, she could feel something, so you have to get to her hands quickly.

13112.content:
“No, it couldn’t be…” she whispers in surprise as she bends down to have a look at you. She pauses for a moment and realizes it is you. “Oh, my God! Brad?!”

It looked as if a mountain was falling overtop of you. You mother’s hand wrapped around your little body, her huge fingers were like tree trunks. You get sick to your stomach as she lifts you up in front of her face. You jump up and down and scream her name in joy!

“Brad… What happened?” she asks as she lifts you up to her ear.

You scream the whole story into her ear, including how Cindy almost stepped on you earlier. By the time you have finished your voice is beyond hoarse, and you need to rest your vocal chords for a moment.

“Oh my. Brad I’m so glad you’re safe, and I think we should keep you out of Cindy’s sight for now. She’s a good girl, but she’s not an angel.”

You nod in agreement. You try to shout again to ask what you should do, but your voice is still strained from before and comes out in an inaudible whisper.

“Okay. We’ve got to act like nothing has happened all right? I can’t believe I’m holding my son in the palm of my hand,” she says laughing, “Now what should we do?”

You mime a police officer.

"I agree," she replies still laughing.
